senses.sense_definition: To bring something into focus or to concentrate attention on a specific subject.

examples.text: The management team decided to <w>focalize</w> their efforts on improving customer service.
This special lens helps to <w>focalize</w> the light rays onto a single point.

senses.sense_definition: To restrict or confine something to a particular location or area.

examples.text: The infection tends to <w>focalize</w> in the lungs before spreading to other parts of the body.
Police tried to <w>focalize</w> the search within the downtown district.

senses.sense_definition: To present a story or narrative from the specific perspective of a character.

examples.text: The author chooses to <w>focalize</w> the narrative through the eyes of a young child.
Although written in the third person, the novel <w>focalizes</w> on the protagonist's inner thoughts.
